item.name: NO_CONFLICT
item.detail:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Advice: 1. Although no conflict, mistakes still come out sometimes, it depends on your device, VENDOR may change AOSP a lot.
2. You could go on to run fullota, flash the outcom into your device, and then fix bugs depends on real-time logs.
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────

item.name: CONFLICTS_HAPPENED
item.detail:
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
Advice: 1. Each conflict is marked out like:
<<<<<<< VENDOR Codes of VENDOR ======= Codes of BOSP >>>>>>> BOSP
you'd better resolve all conflicts before going on with the following work.
2. You might follow three steps to resolve conflicts manually:
- compare VENDOR and REJECT to find out where conflicts happened; - compare AOSP and BOSP to find out why conflicts happened; - resolve conflicts in VENDOR.
────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
